definition: to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
detente

sentences.english: Deaden the gnaw of hunger that way.
sentences.chinese: 借此来缓和一下饥饿的煎熬。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama has struck a mollifying note with China.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马先生对中国政策有所缓和。

sentences.english: The hydroxyapatite-coated prosthesis helped to reduce stress difference at bone and prosthesis interface.
sentences.chinese: 羟磷灰石表面涂层假体能缓和界面层的应力差异。

sentences.english: "Oh, no, " she said breathlessly. "No, I wouldn't like fights.
sentences.chinese: “不，”她缓和地说，“我可不爱好拳击赛。

sentences.english: In order to assuage these worries, the meeting must produce tangible achievements.
sentences.chinese: 为了缓和这些忧虑，会晤必须产生切实的成就。

sentences.english: In their decision last night, finance ministers tried to assuage the markets.
sentences.chinese: 在昨晚的决定中，财政大臣试图缓和市场情况。

sentences.english: Failures do what is tension relieving, while winners do what is goal achieving.
sentences.chinese: 失败者做的是缓和紧张而成功者做的是实现目标。

sentences.english: They could suggest nothing to relieve the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 他们提不出什么办法来缓和危机。

sentences.english: The strategy of appeasement and retreat simply doesn't work.
sentences.chinese: 缓和与退却的战略根本不起作用。

sentences.english: The violence appears to have (a dated) abated somewhat.
sentences.chinese: 暴力时间似乎已经有所缓和。

sentences.english: The depression was slackened off and prosperity was returning.
sentences.chinese: 萧条渐趋缓和，繁荣正在复归。

sentences.english: Will all this assuage the cantankerous markets?
sentences.chinese: 做的所有的努力有可能缓和这个敏感的是市场吗？

sentences.english: That meeting led to an unprecedented détente on the divided Korean Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 此次会晤为朝鲜半岛创造出前所未有的缓和局势。

sentences.english: The two countries reconciled with a fence-mending agreement last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年，两国的修复关系协定缓和了关系。

sentences.english: No mollification of her anger appeared likely.
sentences.chinese: 她的怒气看来无法缓和。

definition: mild/gentle/to ease up/to relax
to dwindle/to vanish/to make vanish/to exercise restraint/to curb (one's mirth, arrogance etc)/to astringe/(math.) to converge
level/almost flat/not strongly sloping/fig. moderate/mild-mannered/gentle
to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to weaken/to fall off
to slow down/to retard
mild/gentle/moderate
lukewarm
to worsen
to improve relations
a little/a bit
to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
